import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Delete organization users by IDs"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"delete"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/organizations/users/ids"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Deletes organization-user relationships for the specified OrganizationUserId values. Use this when you already know the relationship IDs and want a deterministic bulk delete without querying by filters.

**Prerequisites**
1. **OrganizationUserId** - Use [GET /api/v1.0/organizations/users/query](/docs/api/organizations/get-organization-users-by-query-get) and extract `Items[].OrganizationUserId`.

**Workflow Example**
1. Query to assemble the list of relationship IDs.
2. Call [DELETE /api/v1.0/organizations/users/ids](/docs/api/organizations/delete-organization-users-by-ids) with the ID array in the body.

**Minimal Required Fields**: OrganizationUserId array in the request body.

**Notes**: This API version is deprecated and performs a destructive bulk action.

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={undefined}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={{"required":true,"content":{"application/json":{"schema":{"type":"array","items":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"}}}}}}
>
  
</RequestSchema>

  id={undefined}
  label={undefined}

>
  
</StatusCodes>
